member_organisations: www.apimondia.org --> go to "The Federation" menu and click on download string to retrieve the list of member associations
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, International co-operation and development, Environment, Food Safety, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Apimondia is a partner in the three-year EU project "BPRACTICES" aimed at promoting good beekeeping practices particularly on the health dimension, assess their economic impact, devise a technology application for traceability of bee products and disseminating the relevant outcomes. Date of project inception February 2017
organisation_name: Apimondia - International Federation of Beekeepers' Associations (Apimondia)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
In addition to the above-mentioned EU project, Apimondia has also launched a worldwide initiative for licensing bee genetic resources to prevent commercial exploitation of same. 
 
Apimondia is also involved in the proclamation of the World Bee Day within the United Nations' system, with expected endorsement by the UN General Assembly in December 2017. 
 
Apimondia is also looking into producing a flagship publication on beekeeping to act as a reference document for the sector that is scheduled for possible release at the next Apimondia international congress in 2019
goals__remit:
Apimondia exists to promote scientific, technical, ecological, social and economic apicultural development in all countries and the cooperation of beekeepers’ associations, scientific bodies and individuals involved in apiculture worldwide. 
 
It also aims to put into practice every initiative that can contribute to improving apicultural practice and to rendering the obtained products profitable.
